subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Analyze 03 04

choices.content: were members of the planter class
originally migrated to New England as yeoman farmers
were originally indentured servants who sold their services in return for passage to America
owned a large number of slaves

answer_2.response: Consider This: Most seventeenth-century freemen lived on the edge of poverty. Some freemen, of course, did better in America than they would have in England, but in both Virginia and Maryland, historians have found a sharp economic division separating the gentry from the rest of white society. See L.O. 3.2 What factors contributed to political unrest in the Chesapeake region during this period?
